page.title: 08LIVES MRS BRIGG MR MURRAY 1
page.content: Mrs. Brigg aged 84 born 1901 Polesworth.My dad was a butcher in Polesworth.I left school when I was 14 and went to work in the office at Pooley Colliery.I came to Orton when I was 16 as my family owned property here. When I was 21 I eloped with the vicar's son.He had a private education and was training to be a draughtsman. We lived 5 years at the vicarage and then moved to a croft in the garden. The {conditions}were no good for your health. Itwas a happy village in those days. The main road was mud with wells up the street to draw water .There was a {wake}at Orton in August.We had a fair with ponies turning the roundabouts.We had a tea in the school room.An old man from the village played the harmonium,the vicar's wife played the piano and my husband played the bones.
